____________________________________________________________

A review of PTSD and shame in military veterans

Author: Gaudet, Camille M; Sowers, Karen M; Nugent, William R; Boriskin, Jerry A

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 56.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434751?accountid=14667

Abstract: Traumatic military experiences can create ethical dilemmas that result in moral injury. Moral injury is strongly correlated with interpersonal problems, social anxiety, isolation, depression, and suicide. Shame, considered the primary component of moral injury, amplifies the impact of trauma across every category. Shame relates to the trauma experience and is fortified by poor homecomings and the years following veterans&apos; return from battle. Self-criticism acts as a barrier to care and existing assessment and treatment procedures may require modification in order to be fully effective for treating moral injury.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=A+review+of+PTSD+and+shame+in+military+veterans&amp;rft.au=Gaudet%2C+Camille+M%3BSowers%2C+Karen+M%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BBoriskin%2C+Jerry+A&amp;rft.aulast=Gaudet&amp;rft.aufirst=Camille&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=56&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Cyberbullying: A literature review of its relationship to adolescent depression and current intervention strategies

Author: Reed, Karen P; Cooper, R Lyle; Nugent, William R; Russell, Kathryn

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 37.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434765?accountid=14667

Abstract: The focus of this literature review examines interventions for 12-18-year-old adolescents experiencing depressive symptoms as a consequence of cyberbullying. Findings reveal a positive correlation between cyberbullying and depressive symptomology, but only a few interventions treat this problem. This review reinforces the urgent need for the creation of additional evidence-based intervention programs.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=Cyberbullying%3A+A+literature+review+of+its+relationship+to+adolescent+depression+and+current+intervention+strategies&amp;rft.au=Reed%2C+Karen+P%3BCooper%2C+R+Lyle%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BRussell%2C+Kathryn&amp;rft.aulast=Reed&amp;rft.aufirst=Karen&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=37&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

BASICS, ACT, mindfulness, and BMI: Effective evidence-based practices that treat collegiate high-risk drinking

Author: Wilson, Shanika L; Cooper, R Lyle; Nugent, William R; Champion, Denisha

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 81.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434786?accountid=14667

Abstract: This literature review focuses on the use of Brief Alcohol Screening and Intervention for College Students (BASICS), Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT), Mindfulness, and Brief Motivational Interventions (BMI) during individual evidence-based therapeutic interventions with college students engaging in high-risk drinking. A review of family history, drinking motives, and the collegiate environment is also examined for empirical and theoretical etiology of college student alcohol abuse.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=BASICS%2C+ACT%2C+mindfulness%2C+and+BMI%3A+Effective+evidence-based+practices+that+treat+collegiate+high-risk+drinking&amp;rft.au=Wilson%2C+Shanika+L%3BCooper%2C+R+Lyle%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BChampion%2C+Denisha&amp;rft.aulast=Wilson&amp;rft.aufirst=Shanika&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=81&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Facets of mindfulness related to a change in anxiety following a mindfulness-based intervention

Author: Mizera, Carin M; Bolin, Rebecca M; Nugent, William R; Strand, Elizabeth B

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 100.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434817?accountid=14667

Abstract: Mindfulness has been operationalized into five facets that can be measured: Observe, Describe, Act with Awareness, Nonjudgment, and Nonreactivity. The purpose of this literature review is to determine if any single facet of mindfulness is more robustly associated with a change in anxiety. Five studies measuring changes in mindfulness facets following a mindfulness-based intervention and their effects on anxiety symptoms were examined. The results of this review are inconclusive. No clear connection emerged based on the literature reviewed, though the facet of Nonjudgment may have a stronger relationship with a change in anxiety based on these studies.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=Facets+of+mindfulness+related+to+a+change+in+anxiety+following+a+mindfulness-based+intervention&amp;rft.au=Mizera%2C+Carin+M%3BBolin%2C+Rebecca+M%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BStrand%2C+Elizabeth+B&amp;rft.aulast=Mizera&amp;rft.aufirst=Carin&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=100&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

A review of the effectiveness of military suicide prevention programs in reducing rates of military suicides

Author: Harmon, Lisa M; Cooper, R Lyle; Nugent, William R; Butcher, Jimmie J

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 15.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434864?accountid=14667

Abstract: The suicide rate within the U.S. armed forces remains a pressing issue for the country. This comprehensive literature review found only five published studies on military suicide prevention programs and their outcomes. Substantial research design and methodological issues are noted, and only one study produces statistically significant results. Findings reveal a serious lack of empirical evidence demonstrating effective suicide prevention programs within the U.S. armed forces.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=A+review+of+the+effectiveness+of+military+suicide+prevention+programs+in+reducing+rates+of+military+suicides&amp;rft.au=Harmon%2C+Lisa+M%3BCooper%2C+R+Lyle%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BButcher%2C+Jimmie+J&amp;rft.aulast=Harmon&amp;rft.aufirst=Lisa&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=15&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Evidence-based gatekeeper suicide prevention in a small community context

Author: Herron, Freida B; Patterson, David A; Nugent, William R; Troyer, Jason M

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 25.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434867?accountid=14667

Abstract: This review examines 10 studies of suicide prevention programs conducted in small communities using these programs: (1) Applied Suicide Intervention Skills Training (ASIST), (2) Connect, (3) Campus Connect, and (4) Question, Persuade, and Refer (QPR). These evidence-based programs are listed in the Best Practices Registry funded by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration. The programs with the strongest evidence of efficacy and effectiveness are ASIST and QPR. Recommendations are the following: (1) increase research on prevention programs with diverse trainees; (2) create decision models that consider program costs relative to impacts; and (3) develop more suicide prevention programs that target at-risk adults.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=Evidence-based+gatekeeper+suicide+prevention+in+a+small+community+context&amp;rft.au=Herron%2C+Freida+B%3BPatterson%2C+David+A%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BTroyer%2C+Jason+M&amp;rft.aulast=Herron&amp;rft.aufirst=Freida&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=25&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Sexual addiction: A literature review of treatment interventions

Author: Miles, Laurie A; Cooper, R Lyle; Nugent, William R; Ellis, Rodney A

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 89.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434874?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article reviewed the available studies of treatments for individuals suffering from sexual addiction. Sexual addiction may affect as many as 3-5% of all Americans and can result in dire consequences for those affected. Because the existence of sexual addiction remains controversial, this problem has been understudied. A search of five databases for peer-reviewed studies revealed a dearth of empirical studies on targeted treatments for sexual addiction. The treatment modalities that have been studied are primarily modified cognitive behavioral techniques, as well as expressive and exposure techniques. Seven studies were selected for this review. The studies had several methodological weaknesses, with two showing promising outcomes. More research is needed in the area of sexual addiction.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=Sexual+addiction%3A+A+literature+review+of+treatment+interventions&amp;rft.au=Miles%2C+Laurie+A%3BCooper%2C+R+Lyle%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BEllis%2C+Rodney+A&amp;rft.aulast=Miles&amp;rft.aufirst=Laurie&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=89&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Veterinary social work: Practice within veterinary settings

Author: Holcombe, T Melissa; Strand, Elizabeth B; Nugent, William R; Ng, Zenithson Y

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 69.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434875?accountid=14667

Abstract: Veterinary social work (VSW) is the provision of services at the intersection of veterinary medicine and social work practice. Based on scholarly literature and practice experience, four competency areas are identified for social workers attending to the human side of the human-animal bond: grief at the loss of an animal companion, compassion fatigue in the animal services fields, the connection between animal and human violence, and animal-assisted interventions. This review explores how the four competency areas of VSW have evolved, to what extent these services are being provided, and in what realms these services exist.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=Veterinary+social+work%3A+Practice+within+veterinary+settings&amp;rft.au=Holcombe%2C+T+Melissa%3BStrand%2C+Elizabeth+B%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BNg%2C+Zenithson+Y&amp;rft.aulast=Holcombe&amp;rft.aufirst=T&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=69&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=Veterinary+social+work%3A+Practice+within+veterinary+settings&amp;rft.au=Holcombe%2C+T+Melissa%3BStrand%2C+Elizabeth+B%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BNg%2C+Zenithson+Y&amp;rft.aulast=Holcombe&amp;rft.aufirst=T&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=69&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Addressing negative affect in substance use relapse prevention

Author: Olsson, Kurt L; Cooper, R Lyle; Nugent, William R; Reid, Rory C

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 2.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434893?accountid=14667

Abstract: This review includes 15 studies, evaluating evidence of the effectiveness of interventions addressing negative affect in substance use relapse prevention. A unitary construct of "negative affect" was inadequate for reconciling conflicting findings. Instead, affect variables were divided by temporal range, model of affect, and discreteness of measurement. Results strongly support (1) cognitive behavioral therapy&apos;s effectiveness for changing tonic affect and (2) mindfulness interventions effectively changing both tonic and phasic affect. Evidence also supports mindfulness weakening the relationship between affect and substance use outcomes. Recommendations for future research are made.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=Addressing+negative+affect+in+substance+use+relapse+prevention&amp;rft.au=Olsson%2C+Kurt+L%3BCooper%2C+R+Lyle%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BReid%2C+Rory+C&amp;rft.aulast=Olsson&amp;rft.aufirst=Kurt&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=2&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=Addressing+negative+affect+in+substance+use+relapse+prevention&amp;rft.au=Olsson%2C+Kurt+L%3BCooper%2C+R+Lyle%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BReid%2C+Rory+C&amp;rft.aulast=Olsson&amp;rft.aufirst=Kurt&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=2&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

How children verbally reported their experiences of a genital exam

Author: Dupree, Lisa; Patterson, David A; Nugent, William R; White, Sue Fort

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 110.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434943?accountid=14667

Abstract: This literature review examines five empirical studies that researchers conducted to investigate children&apos;s reports about their experience of undergoing a genital examination. Findings show older children tend to provide more extensive and accurate accounts of their experiences than younger children, who are particularly vulnerable when questioned about genital touch. Results further reveal that the use of anatomical dolls with young children contributes to errors and that children commit errors of omission as well as errors of commission. Factors associated with accurate and inaccurate recall are highlighted, and areas in need of further exploration are identified.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=How+children+verbally+reported+their+experiences+of+a+genital+exam&amp;rft.au=Dupree%2C+Lisa%3BPatterson%2C+David+A%3BNugent%2C+William+R%3BWhite%2C+Sue+Fort&amp;rft.aulast=Dupree&amp;rft.aufirst=Lisa&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=110&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

A literature review of forgiveness as a beneficial intervention to increase relationship satisfaction in couples therapy

Author: Aalgaard, Ross A; Bolen, Rebecca M; Nugent, William R

Publication info: Journal of Human Behavior in the Social Environment ; Abingdon  Vol. 26, Iss. 1,  (2016): 46.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1737434944?accountid=14667

Abstract: Forgiveness between couples is identified as a strong predictor of relationship satisfaction. Yet forgiveness is often overlooked as a potential intervention to help couples increase their relational satisfaction. The purpose of this literature review is to examine the use of forgiveness as a therapeutic intervention to increase relational satisfaction for opposite- and same-sex couple dyads. Forgiveness is also introduced as an effective component of marital interventions in the context of infidelity. Specific areas that are addressed within this article include forgiving personalities, which benefits stress and health, forgiveness affecting marital and family functioning, forgiveness and relationship satisfaction with mediating mechanisms, and limitations of forgiveness interventions. Recommendations for practice are offered.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.atitle=A+literature+review+of+forgiveness+as+a+beneficial+intervention+to+increase+relationship+satisfaction+in+couples+therapy&amp;rft.au=Aalgaard%2C+Ross+A%3BBolen%2C+Rebecca+M%3BNugent%2C+William+R&amp;rft.aulast=Aalgaard&amp;rft.aufirst=Ross&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=26&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=46&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Human+Behavior+in+the+Social+Environment&amp;rft.issn=10911359&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Personal values and support of welfare policy among undergraduate students in Israel

Author: Guy, Anat

Publication info: International Journal of Social Welfare ; Oxford  Vol. 25, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 78-85.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1738990274?accountid=14667

Abstract: Sociological and socio-psychological theories maintain that values play an essential role in predicting attitudes. Most research portraying the effect of a single value on various attitudes claims that the effect of values on attitudes increases if the attitudes and the specific values are related or if the attitudes involve objects or situations that reflect specific values. This exploratory study examined the relationship between personal values, considered as components of an individual's mindset or psychological structure, and attitudes supporting social welfare policy. The participants in the study were Israeli Bachelor of Arts students from four institutions of higher learning. The students' personal values were measured, and the effect of their values (beyond the students' socio-demographic characteristics such as gender, religiosity etc.) on social support for welfare policy was tested.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Personal+values+and+support+of+welfare+policy+among+undergraduate+students+in+Israel&amp;rft.au=Guy%2C+Anat&amp;rft.aulast=Guy&amp;rft.aufirst=Anat&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=78&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12156

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Personal+values+and+support+of+welfare+policy+among+undergraduate+students+in+Israel&amp;rft.au=Guy%2C+Anat&amp;rft.aulast=Guy&amp;rft.aufirst=Anat&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=78&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12156

____________________________________________________________

Common paths, divergent patterns: The social protection by other means approach in Australia and Japan

Author: Hwang, Gyu-Jin

Publication info: International Journal of Social Welfare ; Oxford  Vol. 25, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 36-46.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1738990282?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article reports on a study of the welfare reform trajectories of two countries that are often identified in the literature as having institutional patterns of the 'social protection by the other means' approach. It is questioned in the article whether these two countries have undergone a converging reform trajectory against the increasing forces of economic liberalisation and whether their distinct ways of doing social policy have now come to an end. It argues that while both Australia and Japan have followed a similar neoliberal path in their social policy reform direction, the forms and patterns they have taken to follow have been distinct, largely aligned with the existing structure of social protection in each. Distinctive strategies of welfare adopted by each country have led to a divergent pattern in their way of doing social policy.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Common+paths%2C+divergent+patterns%3A+The+social+protection+by+other+means+approach+in+Australia+and+Japan&amp;rft.au=Hwang%2C+Gyu-Jin&amp;rft.aulast=Hwang&amp;rft.aufirst=Gyu-Jin&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=36&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12161

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Common+paths%2C+divergent+patterns%3A+The+social+protection+by+other+means+approach+in+Australia+and+Japan&amp;rft.au=Hwang%2C+Gyu-Jin&amp;rft.aulast=Hwang&amp;rft.aufirst=Gyu-Jin&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=36&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12161

____________________________________________________________

Re-conceptualising the link between research and practice in social work: A literature review on knowledge utilisation

Author: Heinsch, Milena; Gray, Mel; Sharland, Elaine

Publication info: International Journal of Social Welfare ; Oxford  Vol. 25, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 98-104.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1738990295?accountid=14667

Abstract: Despite the recent movement towards greater research use in many areas of social work, criticisms persist that decision making in practice is seldom informed by sound research evidence. Discourse about the research-to-practice gap in social work has tended to focus on the feasibility of evidence-based practice for the profession, but has rarely drawn from the broader knowledge utilisation literature. There are important understandings to be gained from the knowledge utilisation field, which spans more than six decades of interdisciplinary research.This article introduces the wider knowledge utilisation literature to a social work audience. It considers the potential of this body of literature to facilitate research use in social work, as well as conceptual issues that may be hindering it from informing improvements to research utilisation in practice.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Re-conceptualising+the+link+between+research+and+practice+in+social+work%3A+A+literature+review+on+knowledge+utilisation&amp;rft.au=Heinsch%2C+Milena%3BGray%2C+Mel%3BSharland%2C+Elaine&amp;rft.aulast=Heinsch&amp;rft.aufirst=Milena&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=98&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12164

Trust and health in Eastern Europe: Conceptions of a new society

Author: Carlson, Per

Publication info: International Journal of Social Welfare ; Oxford  Vol. 25, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 69-77.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1738990308?accountid=14667

Abstract: Little attention has been paid to why trends and levels of mortality and morbidity differ in Eastern Europe and few studies have addressed people's own perceptions of their new political system - perceptions which per se may be important for social development. The aim of the present study was to analyse the extent to which trust and economic circumstances affect self-rated health in Poland, Estonia and Russia and how much health differences between the countries can be explained by these factors. A better economy and higher trust were related to better individual health, while economic factors seemed most important for inter-country differences. It is probable that both institutional factors and individual perceptions contribute to people's well-being, but in terms of social policy, an improved welfare system may be the most effective way forward.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Trust+and+health+in+Eastern+Europe%3A+Conceptions+of+a+new+society&amp;rft.au=Carlson%2C+Per&amp;rft.aulast=Carlson&amp;rft.aufirst=Per&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=69&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12165

Effects of individualised follow-up on activation programme participants' self-sufficiency: A cluster-randomised study

Author: Malmberg-Heimonen, Ira; Toge, Anne Grete

Publication info: International Journal of Social Welfare ; Oxford  Vol. 25, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 27-35.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1738990321?accountid=14667

Abstract: Recent developments within activation policies emphasise tailor-made and individualised services; however, little is known of what the effects of these initiatives are. The aim of this study was, therefore, to analyse, in a cluster-randomised design, the long-term effects of an individualised follow-up model on welfare recipients' self-sufficiency. The follow-up model systematises the work done by social workers within the Qualification Programme, which is a welfare-to-work programme in Norway. In the study, 18 labour and welfare offices were randomised to experimental and control groups. The data consist of baseline questionnaires for Qualification Programme participants (n = 617) and follow-ups based on administrative data at 12, 24 and 30 months after baseline. The results show significant effects of individualised follow-up on self-sufficiency at the 30-month follow-up and strong positive trends at the 18- and 24-month follow-ups. Thus, comprehensive and individualised follow-up of participants within activation programmes seems to generate positive long-term effects on self-sufficiency.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Effects+of+individualised+follow-up+on+activation+programme+participants%27+self-sufficiency%3A+A+cluster-randomised+study&amp;rft.au=Malmberg-Heimonen%2C+Ira%3BToge%2C+Anne+Grete&amp;rft.aulast=Malmberg-Heimonen&amp;rft.aufirst=Ira&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=27&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12179

Moral distress among social workers: The role of insufficient resources

Author: Manttari-van der Kuip, Maija

Publication info: International Journal of Social Welfare ; Oxford  Vol. 25, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 86-97.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1738990324?accountid=14667

Abstract: The present study examined moral distress among Finnish social workers and the role of perceived resource insufficiencies in explaining it. The aim was to shed light on this understudied phenomenon in the field of social welfare. The study focused on work-related moral distress, defined as impaired wellbeing that is connected to the continual inability to implement actions that one considers morally appropriate. The survey data were collected with an electronic questionnaire between the years 2011 and 2012. The respondents (n = 817) were social workers in the public social welfare services and the overall response rate was 46.5percent. Nearly 11percent of the respondents reported experiencing moral distress and perceived resource insufficiencies strongly explained this experience. Moreover, social workers with moral distress reported that they were less willing to continue in their post, were more frequently on sick leave and had positive work-related experiences less often than their colleagues who did not experience moral distress. Key Practitioner Message: -- The concept of moral distress is useful in describing the experiences of social welfare workers when they are unable to practise their profession according to their moral code and the emotional burden related to this inability; -- Perceived resource insufficiencies are strongly associated with experiences of moral distress among frontline social workers; -- Social workers experiencing moral distress are less willing to continue in their work, take sick leave more often and less frequently have positive experiences related to their work.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Moral+distress+among+social+workers%3A+The+role+of+insufficient+resources&amp;rft.au=Manttari-van+der+Kuip%2C+Maija&amp;rft.aulast=Manttari-van+der+Kuip&amp;rft.aufirst=Maija&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=86&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12163

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Moral+distress+among+social+workers%3A+The+role+of+insufficient+resources&amp;rft.au=Manttari-van+der+Kuip%2C+Maija&amp;rft.aulast=Manttari-van+der+Kuip&amp;rft.aufirst=Maija&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=86&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12163

Protecting children from nutritional and medical neglect in sub-Saharan Africa: A five-country study

Author: Laird, Siobhan E

Publication info: International Journal of Social Welfare ; Oxford  Vol. 25, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 47-57.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1738990428?accountid=14667

Abstract: This study critically considers the applicability of conceptions of child neglect that have been theorised by British and American scholars and promulgated in African countries through the domestication of the Convention on the Rights of the Child. The child protection legislation of five sub-Saharan nations was compared in order to examine the presumptions embedded in their provisions concerning child neglect. These were then appraised in relation to the socio-economic conditions pertaining in each country. Food insecurity, over-reliance on staples and high infection rates among children in conjunction with hard to access health care and poor quality services contest the validity and relevance of dominant Anglo-centric definitions of child neglect and methods for detecting it. The study concluded that greater congruence between national child protection legislation and the socio-economic challenges faced by families in sub-Saharan countries would better protect children against neglect. Key Practitioner Message: -- Child neglect is an ethnocentric concept that requires interrogation to test its relevance before applying it to developing country contexts. -- In sub-Saharan countries, conditions of absolute poverty and grossly inadequate public services profoundly affect the ability of parents or guardians to meet their children's basic needs. -- Laws that frame child protection systems need to recognise the inter-relationship between public services, poverty and parental care in the neglect of children.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Protecting+children+from+nutritional+and+medical+neglect+in+sub-Saharan+Africa%3A+A+five-country+study&amp;rft.au=Laird%2C+Siobhan+E&amp;rft.aulast=Laird&amp;rft.aufirst=Siobhan&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=47&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12168

____________________________________________________________

Differences and similarities in monetary benefits for informal care in old and new EU member states

Author: Riedel, Monika; Kraus, Markus

Publication info: International Journal of Social Welfare ; Oxford  Vol. 25, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 7-17.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1744615172?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article presents an overview of the monetary benefits available in the context of long-term care provided by family or other informal carers in 11 old and 10 new EU member states. All but one country in our sample offer at least some monetary benefits that can be used to help finance informal care. Old EU member states tend to direct benefits to individuals in need of care, whereas new EU member states place more emphasis on benefits for carers. Among new EU member states, monetary benefits are less often means-tested and tend to be lower compared with benefits in old EU member states. Because social policies in many countries increasingly rely on monetary benefits rather than on benefits in kind and because the share of informal care in the overall provision of elderly care will scarcely decline, monetary benefit incentives for labour market participation need to be carefully monitored.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Differences+and+similarities+in+monetary+benefits+for+informal+care+in+old+and+new+EU+member+states&amp;rft.au=Riedel%2C+Monika%3BKraus%2C+Markus&amp;rft.aulast=Riedel&amp;rft.aufirst=Monika&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=7&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12157

Title: Differences and similarities in monetary benefits for informal care in old and new EU member states

Publication title: International Journal of Social Welfare; Oxford

Volume: 25

Issue: 1

____________________________________________________________

Unemployment and conditional welfare: Exclusion and belonging in immigrant women&apos;s discourse on being long-term dependent on social assistance

Author: Bergnehr, Disa

Publication info: International Journal of Social Welfare ; Oxford  Vol. 25, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 18-26.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1744615178?accountid=14667

Abstract: Long-term unemployment with dependency on social assistance in Sweden has increased and is particularly high among foreign-born persons. The present study explored immigrant recipients&apos; experiences of being welfare reliant. Swedish-Iraqi women&apos;s construction of exclusion and belonging in relation to policies and welfare regulations was scrutinised. The women referred to unemployment with frustration, expressing that it renders dependence on social welfare and enforces adherence to the stipulations of the social services. The individual&apos;s mobility and agency are restricted and concerted efforts to obtain employment are futile, which increase the sense of exclusion. However, the entitlement to social assistance also engenders feelings of belonging, of being connected to and cared for by the new country. More research is needed to examine the role that social assistance regulations play in forming feelings of belonging and exclusion. It appears essential that political initiatives be taken to reverse the trend of high unemployment among foreign-born persons.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Unemployment+and+conditional+welfare%3A+Exclusion+and+belonging+in+immigrant+women%26amp%3Bapos%3Bs+discourse+on+being+long-term+dependent+on+social+assistance&amp;rft.au=Bergnehr%2C+Disa&amp;rft.aulast=Bergnehr&amp;rft.aufirst=Disa&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=18&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12158

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Unemployment+and+conditional+welfare%3A+Exclusion+and+belonging+in+immigrant+women%26amp%3Bapos%3Bs+discourse+on+being+long-term+dependent+on+social+assistance&amp;rft.au=Bergnehr%2C+Disa&amp;rft.aulast=Bergnehr&amp;rft.aufirst=Disa&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=18&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12158

____________________________________________________________

Well-being of migrant and left-behind children in China: Education, health, parenting, and personal values

Author: Lu, Shuang; Lin, Yi-Ting; Vikse, Juliann H; Huang, Chien-Chung

Publication info: International Journal of Social Welfare ; Oxford  Vol. 25, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 58-68.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1744615234?accountid=14667

Abstract: Over the last several decades of urbanization and industrialization, China has encountered mass labor force migration from rural to urban areas. As a result, two-child populations have dramatically increased in number: so-called left-behind children and migrant children. Using data from the 2006 and 2009 China Nutrition and Health Surveys, this study examined the effects of parental migration and residency status on the education, health, parenting, and personal values of children, with particular focus on left-behind and migrant children. The findings suggest that parental migration and residency status play important roles in the educational and health outcomes, parental supervision, and personal values of children. Through analyzing the differences and possible reasons for disparate outcomes among child populations, this study aimed to improve public understanding of migrant and left-behind children&apos;s well-being in China, and explore implications for future studies and welfare policy making. Key Practitioner Message: -- Help to identify the impact of migration on individual, family, and the society domestically and internationally; -- Provide implications for welfare policy making, program design, and service delivery for migrant populations; -- Explore the approaches to addressing migration-related issues in different countries with internal and transnational migrant populations.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Well-being+of+migrant+and+left-behind+children+in+China%3A+Education%2C+health%2C+parenting%2C+and+personal+values&amp;rft.au=Lu%2C+Shuang%3BLin%2C+Yi-Ting%3BVikse%2C+Juliann+H%3BHuang%2C+Chien-Chung&amp;rft.aulast=Lu&amp;rft.aufirst=Shuang&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=58&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12162

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.atitle=Well-being+of+migrant+and+left-behind+children+in+China%3A+Education%2C+health%2C+parenting%2C+and+personal+values&amp;rft.au=Lu%2C+Shuang%3BLin%2C+Yi-Ting%3BVikse%2C+Juliann+H%3BHuang%2C+Chien-Chung&amp;rft.aulast=Lu&amp;rft.aufirst=Shuang&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=58&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Journal+of+Social+Welfare&amp;rft.issn=13696866&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1111%2Fijsw.12162

Teaching Note-Revisiting Stereotypes: Enhancing Cultural Awareness Through a Web-Based Tool

Author: Nadan, Yochay

Publication info: Journal of Social Work Education ; Washington  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (Jan-Mar 2016): 50-56.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1759027625?accountid=14667

Abstract: Educating social work students to work in a diverse, multicultural reality is a major challenge in the profession. This teaching note suggests one method, the Web-based implicit association test, to develop and enhance cultural awareness among social work students. Based on my experience, I propose a framework for using the test to initiate a meaningful learning experience for students.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=Teaching+Note-Revisiting+Stereotypes%3A+Enhancing+Cultural+Awareness+Through+a+Web-Based+Tool&amp;rft.au=Nadan%2C+Yochay&amp;rft.aulast=Nadan&amp;rft.aufirst=Yochay&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=50&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1113054

____________________________________________________________

Embracing the Village and Tribe: Critical Thinking for Social Workers From an African-Centered Approach

Author: Dyson, Yarneccia D; Smith Brice, Tanya

Publication info: Journal of Social Work Education ; Washington  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (Jan/Mar 2016): 108-117.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1759317244?accountid=14667

Abstract: The social work department at a small historically Black college implemented an African-centered approach to the course Critical Thinking for Social Workers for freshmen students who declared social work as their major. We firmly believe that knowing and understanding the history and legacy of people of African descent is extremely important in educating African American students. Various pedagogical techniques, assignments, and intentional lecture topics were used in the implementation of this unique teaching style. This article reports the findings from using the African-centered approach in pedagogy and offers implications for social work education in the 21st century for historically Black colleges and universities and other programs with minority student populations.

Doctoral Study Programs in Social Work at HBCUs: Origin and Program Development

Author: Aubrey, Hal; Jordan, Tina; Stevenson, Andre P; Boss-Victoria, Rena; Haynes, James; Estreet, Anthony; Smith, Jahmaine; Cameron, Elijah; Williams, Quotasze

Publication info: Journal of Social Work Education ; Washington  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (Jan/Mar 2016): 58-68.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1759317259?accountid=14667

Abstract: Fisk University began the genesis of HBCU graduate programs in 1880. During the next fifty years, several other HBCUs established graduate programs. That group included Lincoln, Howard, and Morgan State. However, only Lincoln University established a PhD program. The primary goal of this paper is to provide a historical perspective regarding the development of social work doctoral degree programs in the context of HBCU graduate degree program development. Although HBCU social work doctoral programs have only existed since 1978, they are significant and growing academic enterprises which are expanding the pool of doctoral level social work experts and professors of color. Further, these programs should be viewed contextually as producers of scholars on the larger landscape of the academy.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=Doctoral+Study+Programs+in+Social+Work+at+HBCUs%3A+Origin+and+Program+Development&amp;rft.au=Aubrey%2C+Hal%3BJordan%2C+Tina%3BStevenson%2C+Andre+P%3BBoss-Victoria%2C+Rena%3BHaynes%2C+James%3BEstreet%2C+Anthony%3BSmith%2C+Jahmaine%3BCameron%2C+Elijah%3BWilliams%2C+Quotasze&amp;rft.aulast=Aubrey&amp;rft.aufirst=Hal&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=58&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1117916

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=Doctoral+Study+Programs+in+Social+Work+at+HBCUs%3A+Origin+and+Program+Development&amp;rft.au=Aubrey%2C+Hal%3BJordan%2C+Tina%3BStevenson%2C+Andre+P%3BBoss-Victoria%2C+Rena%3BHaynes%2C+James%3BEstreet%2C+Anthony%3BSmith%2C+Jahmaine%3BCameron%2C+Elijah%3BWilliams%2C+Quotasze&amp;rft.aulast=Aubrey&amp;rft.aufirst=Hal&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=58&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1117916

____________________________________________________________

Business in Social Work Education: A Historically Black University&apos;s Social Work Entrepreneurship Project

Author: Archibald, Paul; Muhammad, Omar; Estreet, Anthony

Publication info: Journal of Social Work Education ; Washington  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (Jan/Mar 2016): 79-94.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1759317312?accountid=14667

Abstract: The destabilization of the current economy has sparked increased interest in entrepreneurship, especially for underrepresented minority social work students. The entrepreneurial thinking of these social work students entering social work programs at historically Black colleges and universities needs to be fostered in a learning environment. This article describes a historically Black university&apos;s creative social entrepreneurship venture in response to the Social Work Congress&apos;s 2010 imperative "Business of Social Work-Infuse models of sustainable business and management practice in social work education and practice." The social entrepreneurship project uses the interprofessional collaborative educational model and attempts to provide meaningful and relevant education to social work students interested in social entrepreneurship through the collaborative efforts of the university&apos;s School of Social Work and the School of Business and Management.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=Business+in+Social+Work+Education%3A+A+Historically+Black+University%26amp%3Bapos%3Bs+Social+Work+Entrepreneurship+Project&amp;rft.au=Archibald%2C+Paul%3BMuhammad%2C+Omar%3BEstreet%2C+Anthony&amp;rft.aulast=Archibald&amp;rft.aufirst=Paul&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=79&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1112643

Student Voices Speak Quality Assurance: Continual Improvement in Online Social Work Education

Author: Secret, Mary; Bentley, Kia J; Kadolph, Jessie C

Publication info: Journal of Social Work Education ; Washington  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (Jan/Mar 2016): 30-42.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1759317369?accountid=14667

Abstract: As social work education expands instruction through the rise of distance education, educators seek new ways to improve quality in online courses. Quality assurance standards and student feedback offer valuable insights to ensure satisfying and effective online learning experiences. An examination of these two assessment approaches concurrently in the context of a 4-year study of student perspectives in MSW Human Behavior and the Social Environment foundation courses illustrates how systematic feedback from students can complement existing quality assurance standards. Of particular importance is the unmistakable strength of student voices about their learning from diverse perspectives in an online collaborative leaning setting that can and should be incorporated into standardized quality assessment guidelines for social work programs.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=Student+Voices+Speak+Quality+Assurance%3A+Continual+Improvement+in+Online+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.au=Secret%2C+Mary%3BBentley%2C+Kia+J%3BKadolph%2C+Jessie+C&amp;rft.aulast=Secret&amp;rft.aufirst=Mary&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=30&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1112630

____________________________________________________________

The Impact and Influence of HBCUs on the Social Work Profession

Author: Bowles, Dorcas D; Hopps, June Gary; Clayton, Obie

Publication info: Journal of Social Work Education ; Washington  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (Jan/Mar 2016): 118-132.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1759317447?accountid=14667

Abstract: Faculties at historically Black colleges and universities (HBCU) have demonstrated stellar contributions to social work, which include early thought and epistemology related to strengths, empowerment, and social justice perspectives; religious orientation; inclusive learning environment, and community-based research. W. E. B. DuBois was the most influential among these HBCU scholars; however, the DuBoisian tradition of scholar as activist must include works of Frazier, Haynes, Young, and others, who fueled discourse on contemporary social problems despite prejudice, discrimination, and Jim Crow. HBCUs provided direction for services to the new Black urban class when the profession was not prepared to do so. They led the profession to use new theoretical ideas, perspectives, and service modes for a new clientele.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=The+Impact+and+Influence+of+HBCUs+on+the+Social+Work+Profession&amp;rft.au=Bowles%2C+Dorcas+D%3BHopps%2C+June+Gary%3BClayton%2C+Obie&amp;rft.aulast=Bowles&amp;rft.aufirst=Dorcas&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=118&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1112650

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=The+Impact+and+Influence+of+HBCUs+on+the+Social+Work+Profession&amp;rft.au=Bowles%2C+Dorcas+D%3BHopps%2C+June+Gary%3BClayton%2C+Obie&amp;rft.aulast=Bowles&amp;rft.aufirst=Dorcas&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=118&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1112650

____________________________________________________________

Putting Principles Into Practice: Addressing Historical Trauma, Mistrust, and Apprehension in Research Methods Courses

Author: Henderson, Zuleka; Acquaye-Doyle, Lucinda A; Waites, Shayna; Howard, Tyriesa

Publication info: Journal of Social Work Education ; Washington  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (Jan/Mar 2016): 69-78.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1759317455?accountid=14667

Abstract: The social work profession has articulated commitments to acknowledging and affirming how diversity and culture shape the human experience and to developing social workers who can competently engage in research-informed practice and practice-informed research. However, there remains a need in social work education for more widespread use of culturally relevant pedagogies that can help achieve these goals. Informed by historical trauma theory and the Black perspective, this article presents a model we used for teaching research to master&apos;s-level social work students at a historically Black university. The article describes assignments and classroom exercises that were used and discusses the implications of this model for culturally informed research curricula that promotes antioppressive research in diverse classroom settings.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=Putting+Principles+Into+Practice%3A+Addressing+Historical+Trauma%2C+Mistrust%2C+and+Apprehension+in+Research+Methods+Courses&amp;rft.au=Henderson%2C+Zuleka%3BAcquaye-Doyle%2C+Lucinda+A%3BWaites%2C+Shayna%3BHoward%2C+Tyriesa&amp;rft.aulast=Henderson&amp;rft.aufirst=Zuleka&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=69&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1112631

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=Putting+Principles+Into+Practice%3A+Addressing+Historical+Trauma%2C+Mistrust%2C+and+Apprehension+in+Research+Methods+Courses&amp;rft.au=Henderson%2C+Zuleka%3BAcquaye-Doyle%2C+Lucinda+A%3BWaites%2C+Shayna%3BHoward%2C+Tyriesa&amp;rft.aulast=Henderson&amp;rft.aufirst=Zuleka&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=69&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1112631

Scholarly Productivity of Social Work Faculty at Historically Black Colleges and Universities: Are h-Index Scores a Suitable Measure?

Author: Marshall, Isiah, Jr; Davis Smith, Belinda; Green, Makeba T; Anderson, Brian; Harry, Sonja V; Byrd, Yolanda M; Pratt-Harris, Natasha C; Bolden, Errol S; Hill, Solomon

Publication info: Journal of Social Work Education ; Washington  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (Jan/Mar 2016): 95-107.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1759317540?accountid=14667

Abstract: Faculty scholarship at historically Black colleges and universities (HBCU) has in the past served as a blueprint for the Black masses. Even today, HBCU faculty scholarship continues to be an informative source to communicate accurate information regarding marginalized groups. This study examines h-index scores of 65 faculty members at five doctorate-granting schools of social work. The majority of calculated h-index scores were considered to be low in terms of productivity. We make the argument that these scores are not a good measure of productivity because of the problematic nature of their use to evaluate HBCU faculty. Implications for future research, practice, and teaching are presented.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=Scholarly+Productivity+of+Social+Work+Faculty+at+Historically+Black+Colleges+and+Universities%3A+Are+h-Index+Scores+a+Suitable+Measure%3F&amp;rft.au=Marshall%2C+Isiah%2C+Jr%3BDavis+Smith%2C+Belinda%3BGreen%2C+Makeba+T%3BAnderson%2C+Brian%3BHarry%2C+Sonja+V%3BByrd%2C+Yolanda+M%3BPratt-Harris%2C+Natasha+C%3BBolden%2C+Errol+S%3BHill%2C+Solomon&amp;rft.aulast=Marshall&amp;rft.aufirst=Isiah&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=95&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1112645

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.atitle=Scholarly+Productivity+of+Social+Work+Faculty+at+Historically+Black+Colleges+and+Universities%3A+Are+h-Index+Scores+a+Suitable+Measure%3F&amp;rft.au=Marshall%2C+Isiah%2C+Jr%3BDavis+Smith%2C+Belinda%3BGreen%2C+Makeba+T%3BAnderson%2C+Brian%3BHarry%2C+Sonja+V%3BByrd%2C+Yolanda+M%3BPratt-Harris%2C+Natasha+C%3BBolden%2C+Errol+S%3BHill%2C+Solomon&amp;rft.aulast=Marshall&amp;rft.aufirst=Isiah&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=95&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.issn=10437797&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1080%2F10437797.2016.1112645

Hearing the voices of young deaf people: Implications for social work practice in Jordan

Author: Al-Makhamreh, Sahar

Publication info: International Social Work ; London  Vol. 59, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 47.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1764078909?accountid=14667

Abstract: This exploratory study discusses the identity construction of young deaf people in Jordan through their own interpretation and the perspectives of their families. It is based on qualitative data derived from focus groups and semi-structured interviews. The findings show that schools and family environments remain predominantly exclusionary in socializing young deaf into the construction of an identity of disability. However, young deaf people view themselves as a sub-group within a larger collective culture. This study takes into account the wider differences inherent in gender issues, as is significant in the conceptualization of young deaf identity in the Arab world. [web URL: http://isw.sagepub.com/content/59/1/47.abstract]

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Hearing+the+voices+of+young+deaf+people%3A+Implications+for+social+work+practice+in+Jordan&amp;rft.au=Al-Makhamreh%2C+Sahar&amp;rft.aulast=Al-Makhamreh&amp;rft.aufirst=Sahar&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=47&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Hearing+the+voices+of+young+deaf+people%3A+Implications+for+social+work+practice+in+Jordan&amp;rft.au=Al-Makhamreh%2C+Sahar&amp;rft.aulast=Al-Makhamreh&amp;rft.aufirst=Sahar&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=47&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Trauma in global contexts: Integrating local practices and socio-cultural meanings into new explanatory frameworks of trauma

Author: Suarez, Eliana Barrios

Publication info: International Social Work ; London  Vol. 59, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 141.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1764078984?accountid=14667

Abstract: Although Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) is only one of the identifiable responses to trauma, it has become the main focus of trauma research, writing, and clinical interventions. The unquestioned use worldwide of PTSD, however, presents the risk of oversimplifying human responses to traumatic events. This article goes beyond critiques of the current trauma paradigm and intends to offer new theoretical tenets whereby multiple local contexts could be better incorporated into trauma discourse and practice. If a renewed trauma paradigm aims to have a role in the global health arena, it should be informed locally and globally. [web URL: http://isw.sagepub.com/content/59/1/141.abstract]

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Trauma+in+global+contexts%3A+Integrating+local+practices+and+socio-cultural+meanings+into+new+explanatory+frameworks+of+trauma&amp;rft.au=Suarez%2C+Eliana+Barrios&amp;rft.aulast=Suarez&amp;rft.aufirst=Eliana&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=141&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Trauma+in+global+contexts%3A+Integrating+local+practices+and+socio-cultural+meanings+into+new+explanatory+frameworks+of+trauma&amp;rft.au=Suarez%2C+Eliana+Barrios&amp;rft.aulast=Suarez&amp;rft.aufirst=Eliana&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=141&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Coping with bereavement of widows in the Chinese cultural context of Hong Kong

Author: Ng, Petrus; Ho, Wing-Chung; Tsun, Angela; Young, Daniel KW

Publication info: International Social Work ; London  Vol. 59, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 115.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1764079046?accountid=14667

Abstract: Although Hong Kong has developed into a Westernized city, many widows still feel the strong pull of cultural demands in coping with the loss of their husbands. The purpose of this study was to explore how Chinese women in Hong Kong cope with bereavement and widowhood. Results reveal that the coping methods of the 26 participants are pragmatic and culturally dependent, and can be grouped into four categories, namely, remaining lonely and stigmatized, submitting to predestination and fate, seeking a transition from feeling aggrieved to active coping, and searching for new family relationships. The implications for social work practice are discussed. [web URL: http://isw.sagepub.com/content/59/1/115.abstract]

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Coping+with+bereavement+of+widows+in+the+Chinese+cultural+context+of+Hong+Kong&amp;rft.au=Ng%2C+Petrus%3BHo%2C+Wing-Chung%3BTsun%2C+Angela%3BYoung%2C+Daniel+KW&amp;rft.aulast=Ng&amp;rft.aufirst=Petrus&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=115&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Coping+with+bereavement+of+widows+in+the+Chinese+cultural+context+of+Hong+Kong&amp;rft.au=Ng%2C+Petrus%3BHo%2C+Wing-Chung%3BTsun%2C+Angela%3BYoung%2C+Daniel+KW&amp;rft.aulast=Ng&amp;rft.aufirst=Petrus&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=115&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Importing Western values versus indigenization: Social work practice with ethnic minorities in Hong Kong

Author: Law, Kam-yee; Lee, Kim-ming

Publication info: International Social Work ; London  Vol. 59, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 60.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1764079083?accountid=14667

Abstract: Serious debate about the indigenization of social work has transpired recently. This article argues that by taking indigenization as an interactive and non-linear process that helps cultivate a multicultural social work practice within a society, importing Western social work practice and indigenization are compatible. In particular, this article attempts to illustrate the compatibility by analyzing how political activists employ Western values and practice, the universal human rights discourse, and mainstreaming, to fight for the rights of Hong Kong ethnic minorities, which may consequently lead to the development of a multicultural social work practice. [web URL: http://isw.sagepub.com/content/59/1/60.abstract]

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Importing+Western+values+versus+indigenization%3A+Social+work+practice+with+ethnic+minorities+in+Hong+Kong&amp;rft.au=Law%2C+Kam-yee%3BLee%2C+Kim-ming&amp;rft.aulast=Law&amp;rft.aufirst=Kam-yee&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=60&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Pre-salt oil, royalties, and sovereign and social funds in Brazil: Challenges and social control

Author: Romao, Frederico Lisboa

Publication info: International Social Work ; London  Vol. 59, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 5.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1764079108?accountid=14667

Abstract: The objective of this study is to analyze the social impact of the use of royalties and special participation, and sovereign and social funds, in the context of the pre-salt oil reserves in Brazil. With the pre-salt discoveries, the royalty values will grow considerably, justifying academic efforts to ensure the socially equitable application of this wealth. There has been enormous growth in the revenue from royalties in oil-producing municipalities; however, this has had little or no impact on social development, social justice, and human rights. It is concluded that oil, and resources derived from oil, are assets of the Union, requiring adequate social control. [web URL: http://isw.sagepub.com/content/59/1/5.abstract]

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Pre-salt+oil%2C+royalties%2C+and+sovereign+and+social+funds+in+Brazil%3A+Challenges+and+social+control&amp;rft.au=Romao%2C+Frederico+Lisboa&amp;rft.aulast=Romao&amp;rft.aufirst=Frederico&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=5&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Child physical punishment and international human rights: Implications for social work education

Author: Watkinson, Ailsa M; Rock, Letnie

Publication info: International Social Work ; London  Vol. 59, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 86.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1764079132?accountid=14667

Abstract: There are increasing calls for the universal implementation of human rights education into the curriculum of schools of social work flowing from international directives including the recent Global Agenda for Social Work and Social Development Commitment to Action. With these directives as backdrop, we use, as a case study, the issue of child physical punishment with particular reference to the Caribbean region. The article discusses the prevalence of child physical punishment, social factors supporting its use, human rights agreements, and current research. Child physical punishment is one example of the breach between international human rights promises and lived realities. [web URL: http://isw.sagepub.com/content/59/1/86.abstract]

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Child+physical+punishment+and+international+human+rights%3A+Implications+for+social+work+education&amp;rft.au=Watkinson%2C+Ailsa+M%3BRock%2C+Letnie&amp;rft.aulast=Watkinson&amp;rft.aufirst=Ailsa&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=86&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Social workers: Peer interaction and hospital integration

Author: Albrithen, Abdulaziz; Yalli, Nadir

Publication info: International Social Work ; London  Vol. 59, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 129.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1764079153?accountid=14667

Abstract: Healthcare has evolved rapidly in Saudi Arabia, based upon a Western model of service which incorporates multi-disciplinary professional teams. Social work practice forms part of patient care. However, little is known about how social workers are integrated into the hospital setting. This study aims to investigate the involvement of hospital social workers with other professionals (e.g. physicians, nurses, psychiatrists, and psychologists). The study uses a qualitative approach to collect its data through a process of semi-structured interviews. The interviews&apos; analysis indicated that medical social workers perceived limitations to effectively executing their tasks because of issues constraining the development of effective partnerships with other professional groups in the hospital. [web URL: http://isw.sagepub.com/content/59/1/129.abstract]

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Social+workers%3A+Peer+interaction+and+hospital+integration&amp;rft.au=Albrithen%2C+Abdulaziz%3BYalli%2C+Nadir&amp;rft.aulast=Albrithen&amp;rft.aufirst=Abdulaziz&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=129&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Social+workers%3A+Peer+interaction+and+hospital+integration&amp;rft.au=Albrithen%2C+Abdulaziz%3BYalli%2C+Nadir&amp;rft.aulast=Albrithen&amp;rft.aufirst=Abdulaziz&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=59&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=129&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=International+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00208728&amp;rft_id=info:doi/
