THE CONTRIBUTION OF SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP IN MEETING THE NEEDS OF ORPHANS IN THE MBERENGWA DISTRICT, ZIMBABWE

Author: Katunga, Wisdom; Lombard, Antoinette

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 2,  (2016): 188.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309626?accountid=14667

Abstract: Since the turn of the millennium Zimbabwe has witnessed a raft of socio-economic and political challenges, exacerbated by the devastating effects of the HIV and Aids pandemic. This diminished the government&apos;s ability to provide safety nets to vulnerable groups. The responsibility for orphan care has been shifted to the community, which has become the core focus of intervention initiatives by devising local-level coping mechanisms to deal with the orphan care crisis. The study explored the contribution of social entrepreneurship in meeting the needs of orphans in the Mberengwa district. The study concludes that the income-generating projects based on social entrepreneurship principles in Mberengwa play an important role in poverty alleviation and social protection, and particularly in meeting the needs of orphans. However, this cannot be achieved without the supportive role of government in promoting private-public partnerships.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=THE+CONTRIBUTION+OF+SOCIAL+ENTREPRENEURSHIP+IN+MEETING+THE+NEEDS+OF+ORPHANS+IN+THE+MBERENGWA+DISTRICT%2C+ZIMBABWE&amp;rft.au=Katunga%2C+Wisdom%3BLombard%2C+Antoinette&amp;rft.aulast=Katunga&amp;rft.aufirst=Wisdom&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=188&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=THE+CONTRIBUTION+OF+SOCIAL+ENTREPRENEURSHIP+IN+MEETING+THE+NEEDS+OF+ORPHANS+IN+THE+MBERENGWA+DISTRICT%2C+ZIMBABWE&amp;rft.au=Katunga%2C+Wisdom%3BLombard%2C+Antoinette&amp;rft.aulast=Katunga&amp;rft.aufirst=Wisdom&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=188&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

CHALLENGES FACED BY UNACCOMPANIED MINOR-REFUGEES IN SOUTH AFRICA

Author: Magqibelo, Lungile; Londt, Marcel; September, Shiron; Roman, Nicolette

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (2016): 73.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309639?accountid=14667

Abstract: This qualitative study explored the experiences of unaccompanied minor-refugees from Zimbabwe to South Africa. Ten (10) participants, from a shelter in Limpopo Province, were selected using purposive sampling. Five childcare workers also participated. Semi-structured interviews were conducted with the minors and a focus group with the childcare workers to collect the data. Thematic analysis was applied for data analysis. The findings revealed that services by statutory social workers were limited, compared to services by social workers employed in non-governmental organisations. The results highlighted the vulnerability to exploitation and a sense of hopelessness that refugee children experience in South Africa. L Magqibelo, M Londt, & NV Roman

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=CHALLENGES+FACED+BY+UNACCOMPANIED+MINOR-REFUGEES+IN+SOUTH+AFRICA&amp;rft.au=Magqibelo%2C+Lungile%3BLondt%2C+Marcel%3BSeptember%2C+Shiron%3BRoman%2C+Nicolette&amp;rft.aulast=Magqibelo&amp;rft.aufirst=Lungile&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=73&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

PRAKTYKOPLEIERS SE PERSEPSIES VAN MAATSKAPLIKEWERK-PRAKTYKOPLEIDING

Author: von Wielligh, Nadia; Wilson, Lizane

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 2,  (2016): 280.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309640?accountid=14667

Abstract: The Bachelor of Social Work (BSW) degree was developed to equip students with the knowledge and skills to address socioeconomic issues from a developmental paradigm. Field education reflects the reality of the profession and the context in which it is utilised. Hence, field education is viewed as an integral and valuable part of the education and preparation of students for practice. The research objective of this study was to undertake a qualitative exploratory and descriptive study of the perceptions of field instructors in terms of the current state of social work practice training. The data was collected through semi-structured interviews with field instructors.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=PRAKTYKOPLEIERS+SE+PERSEPSIES+VAN+MAATSKAPLIKEWERK-PRAKTYKOPLEIDING&amp;rft.au=von+Wielligh%2C+Nadia%3BWilson%2C+Lizane&amp;rft.aulast=von+Wielligh&amp;rft.aufirst=Nadia&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=280&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

THE ROLE OF MINDFULNESS IN THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN LIFE SATISFACTION AND SPIRITUAL WELLBEING AMONGST THE ELDERLY

Author: Bester, Edelweiss; Naidoo, Pravani; Botha, Anja

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 2,  (2016): 245.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309642?accountid=14667

Abstract: A non-experimental research design was used to investigate the role of mindfulness in the relationship between life satisfaction and spiritual wellbeing amongst elderly residents (N=122) from two retirement villages in Bloemfontein. A biographical questionnaire, the Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MAAS), the Spiritual Well-being Questionnaire (SWBQ), and the Satisfaction with Life Scale (SWLS) were utilised. This study yielded a statistically significant relationship between mindfulness, life satisfaction and spiritual wellbeing. Mindfulness was also a moderator in the relationship between life satisfaction and spiritual wellbeing. These findings can inform social work interventions aimed at optimising life satisfaction and spiritual wellbeing amongst the elderly.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=THE+ROLE+OF+MINDFULNESS+IN+THE+RELATIONSHIP+BETWEEN+LIFE+SATISFACTION+AND+SPIRITUAL+WELLBEING+AMONGST+THE+ELDERLY&amp;rft.au=Bester%2C+Edelweiss%3BNaidoo%2C+Pravani%3BBotha%2C+Anja&amp;rft.aulast=Bester&amp;rft.aufirst=Edelweiss&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=245&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

RELATIONSHIP BUILDING DURING THE INITIAL PHASE OF SOCIAL WORK INTERVENTION WITH CHILD CLIENTS IN A RURAL AREA

Author: Marais, Cecilia; van der Merwe, Mariette

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 2,  (2016): 145.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309675?accountid=14667

Abstract: Establishing a helping relationship between child clients and social workers is essential to the successful outcome of social work intervention. This research qualitatively explored, with a case study design through semi-structured interviewing, the experiences of social workers and child clients regarding their initial contact-making in a rural Boland area. The themes that emerged concerned the rationale for relationship building, contextual factors, barriers to relationship building and the importance of the social worker&apos;s professional attributes. Lastly, a pattern emerged regarding engagement of a child client during the initial session.

THE DESIGN OF A PROTOCOL FOR ASSESSING PROSPECTIVE FOSTER PARENTS IN SOUTH AFRICA

Author: Carter, Juliet; van Breda, Adrian

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 2,  (2016): 208.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309686?accountid=14667

Abstract: This paper reports on the development of a contextually appropriate protocol in social work for the assessment of prospective foster parents in South Africa. The protocol was designed in two stages using Thomas&apos;s developmental research process and participatory action research methodologies. First, we designed a model of the competencies of effective foster families (determining "what" constitutes a good foster parent and developing a model of the "ideal" foster parents). Second, we designed and developed an assessment protocol with which to assess prospective foster families (specifying "how" one determines if foster parents meet the model&apos;s criteria of the ideal foster parents).

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=THE+DESIGN+OF+A+PROTOCOL+FOR+ASSESSING+PROSPECTIVE+FOSTER+PARENTS+IN+SOUTH+AFRICA&amp;rft.au=Carter%2C+Juliet%3Bvan+Breda%2C+Adrian&amp;rft.aulast=Carter&amp;rft.aufirst=Juliet&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=208&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=THE+DESIGN+OF+A+PROTOCOL+FOR+ASSESSING+PROSPECTIVE+FOSTER+PARENTS+IN+SOUTH+AFRICA&amp;rft.au=Carter%2C+Juliet%3Bvan+Breda%2C+Adrian&amp;rft.aulast=Carter&amp;rft.aufirst=Juliet&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=208&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Subject: Parents; Action research; Social work; Research methodology; Surrogate parents; Social science research; Foster care

Location: South Africa

Title: THE DESIGN OF A PROTOCOL FOR ASSESSING PROSPECTIVE FOSTER PARENTS IN SOUTH AFRICA

LESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL, TRANSGENDER AGEING AND CARE: A LITERATURE STUDY

Author: Henderson, Neil; Almack, Kathryn

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 2,  (2016): 267.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309687?accountid=14667

Abstract: There is an increasing body of research on ageing and end-of-life care (EOLC) of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) older people in the UK, USA and Australia. In contrast, in South Africa, despite progressive legislation to protect LGBT rights, there has been minimal research in this area. This article reports on a critical review of literature on ageing of the LGBT community. Key themes identified include discrimination by health care workers and health risks for LGBT older people alongside the need for training of health professionals. The article concludes with consideration of the needs of LGBT persons in South Africa.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=LESBIAN%2C+GAY%2C+BISEXUAL%2C+TRANSGENDER+AGEING+AND+CARE%3A+A+LITERATURE+STUDY&amp;rft.au=Henderson%2C+Neil%3BAlmack%2C+Kathryn&amp;rft.aulast=Henderson&amp;rft.aufirst=Neil&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=267&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

PERSPECTIVES OF PATIENTS AND CAREGIVERS ON THE LOGISTICAL BARRIERS TO PROVIDING MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES IN UGANDA

Author: Twesigye, Justus; Kagee, Ashraf

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (2016): 19.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309695?accountid=14667

Abstract: Mental disorders contribute substantially to the global burden of disease. Although mental disorders can be treated effectively, logistical barriers constrain the provision of evidence-based treatment in low- and middle-income countries. However, little is known about these barriers to treatment of patients in Uganda. We interviewed patients and care providers about their views on logistical barriers to the provision of mental health services. Results indicate that inadequate staffing, irregular medical supplies and the use of inferior medication constrained the delivery and utilisation of mental health services. Implications of these barriers include burnout among care providers and non-adherence to medical treatment among patients.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=PERSPECTIVES+OF+PATIENTS+AND+CAREGIVERS+ON+THE+LOGISTICAL+BARRIERS+TO+PROVIDING+MENTAL+HEALTH+SERVICES+IN+UGANDA&amp;rft.au=Twesigye%2C+Justus%3BKagee%2C+Ashraf&amp;rft.aulast=Twesigye&amp;rft.aufirst=Justus&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=19&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

FACTORS CONTRIBUTING TO THE BREAKDOWN OF FOSTER CARE PLACEMENTS: THE PERSPECTIVES OF FOSTER PARENTS AND ADOLESCENTS

Author: Mnisi, Rosina; Botha, Petro

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 2,  (2016): 227.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309696?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article describes the factors contributing to the breakdown of foster care placements of adolescents from the perspective of the foster parents and adolescents involved. It was found that all the placements in the sample were kinship foster care placements. Although similar factors were identified, the perspectives of foster parents and adolescents differed. Disruptive behaviour of adolescents, including substance abuse, inappropriate sexual behaviour and involvement in the occult were identified. Physical and emotional abuse by foster parents and the involvement of biological parents were also isolated as contributory factors. Recommendations for practice and further research were made.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=FACTORS+CONTRIBUTING+TO+THE+BREAKDOWN+OF+FOSTER+CARE+PLACEMENTS%3A+THE+PERSPECTIVES+OF+FOSTER+PARENTS+AND+ADOLESCENTS&amp;rft.au=Mnisi%2C+Rosina%3BBotha%2C+Petro&amp;rft.aulast=Mnisi&amp;rft.aufirst=Rosina&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=227&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

POLICE SOCIAL WORK IN SOUTH AFRICA

Author: Williams, Marili

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (2016): 130.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309714?accountid=14667

Abstract: The core business of the South African Police Service (SAPS) is "to create a safe and secure environment for all citizens of South Africa" (SAPS, 2011:i). Social workers applying occupational social work practice fundamentals are expected to address both the organisational wellbeing of the SAPS and the social wellbeing of the personnel, but as a secondary entity within a structured, semimilitary environment. This article elaborates critically on the position of police social work and argues why social workers employed by the SAPS should be acknowledged as specialists in the field of occupational social work.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=POLICE+SOCIAL+WORK+IN+SOUTH+AFRICA&amp;rft.au=Williams%2C+Marili&amp;rft.aulast=Williams&amp;rft.aufirst=Marili&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=130&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

SUBJECTIVITIES OF SURVIVAL: CONCEPTUALISING JUST RESPONSES TO DISPLACEMENT, CROSS-BORDER MIGRATION AND STRUCTURAL VIOLENCE IN SOUTH AFRICA

Author: Hölscher, Dorothee

Publication info: Social Work = Maatskaplike Werk ; Stellenbosch  Vol. 52, Iss. 1,  (2016): 54.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1811309715?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article considers the implications for social work of displacement, migration and structural violence in urban South Africa. To this end, I explore the life stories of five cross-border migrants. I find that all five form part of South Africa&apos;s larger pool of surplus populations but face additional, citizenship-based forms of exclusion. Even though generally self-reliant, all of them experienced cumulative agency constraints and felt vulnerable. Against this background, I propose that current, refugee-centred services should be expanded and that interventions should be carefully balanced to attend to structural issues, inter-group conflict and the range of vulnerabilities articulated by cross-border migrants

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=SUBJECTIVITIES+OF+SURVIVAL%3A+CONCEPTUALISING+JUST+RESPONSES+TO+DISPLACEMENT%2C+CROSS-BORDER+MIGRATION+AND+STRUCTURAL+VIOLENCE+IN+SOUTH+AFRICA&amp;rft.au=H%C3%B6lscher%2C+Dorothee&amp;rft.aulast=H%C3%B6lscher&amp;rft.aufirst=Dorothee&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=54&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.atitle=SUBJECTIVITIES+OF+SURVIVAL%3A+CONCEPTUALISING+JUST+RESPONSES+TO+DISPLACEMENT%2C+CROSS-BORDER+MIGRATION+AND+STRUCTURAL+VIOLENCE+IN+SOUTH+AFRICA&amp;rft.au=H%C3%B6lscher%2C+Dorothee&amp;rft.aulast=H%C3%B6lscher&amp;rft.aufirst=Dorothee&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=52&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=54&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+%3D+Maatskaplike+Werk&amp;rft.issn=00378054&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Middle Class Evolving To Precariat: Labour Conditions for the 21st Century

Author: Alonso, Andoni; Ferreira, Sílvia; Alonso, David

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816648418?accountid=14667

Abstract: Middle Class has become a confusing term. Low, medium and high middle classes are attempts to reorganize meaning. The appearance of new middle classes in emergent countries adds new difficulties to make sense of the concept. This is the reason why some authors disqualify the very notion of middle class. This paper tries to articulate the appearance of a new social class, the precariat that absorbs part of the falling members of middle class and working class in general. It is proposed also to revise two basic concepts concerning middle classes: the public good and consumerism in order to give political content for this concept. Public should be transformed into commons and de-growth should be a guideline for future political action.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Middle+Class+Evolving+To+Precariat%3A+Labour+Conditions+for+the+21st+Century&amp;rft.au=Alonso%2C+Andoni%3BFerreira%2C+S%C3%ADlvia%3BAlonso%2C+David&amp;rft.aulast=Alonso&amp;rft.aufirst=Andoni&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Middle+Class+Evolving+To+Precariat%3A+Labour+Conditions+for+the+21st+Century&amp;rft.au=Alonso%2C+Andoni%3BFerreira%2C+S%C3%ADlvia%3BAlonso%2C+David&amp;rft.aulast=Alonso&amp;rft.aufirst=Andoni&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Multiple Family SES Indices: Variations between Middle Class and Lower Social Class Undergraduate Samples

Author: Reyes, Melissa Lopez

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816649665?accountid=14667

Abstract: In the face of socioeconomic hardships, social work programs for youth have been targeting not only the lower social class but also the middle class. To address the need for socioeconomic status (SES) screening of prospective program beneficiaries, family SES indices were constructed for two largely middle-class undergraduate samples and a socioeconomically disadvantaged working-student sample from the Philippines. Indices were constructed for assets, housing and appliances, perceived financial difficulties, financially-draining life circumstances, and financing. Loadings resulting from nonlinear principal component analysis served as bases for reducing the indicators for an index. The resulting indices for the middle and lower social class samples largely differ in their indicators and underlying factor, reflecting the different extent and patterns of socioeconomic adversity. The indices for the middle class sample distinguish between objective indicators and perceived financial difficulties. The indices for the lower social class reflect a pervasive and multidimensional experience of socioeconomic adversity.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Multiple+Family+SES+Indices%3A+Variations+between+Middle+Class+and+Lower+Social+Class+Undergraduate+Samples&amp;rft.au=Reyes%2C+Melissa+Lopez&amp;rft.aulast=Reyes&amp;rft.aufirst=Melissa&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Crisis, social class, employment and education

Author: de Lucas, Fernando

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816649822?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article reviews the position of the middle classes in Spain during the economic crisis, and the impact of the crisis in the Mediterranean region. To do so, we review the transformation in Spanish social stratification during the latter years of Franco's regime and the country's adaptation to democracy within a context of European integration. The profound change in Spanish society over the last forty years has given rise to a new social structure, and has encompassed three clearly interwoven phenomena: changes in the labour market; the subsidiarity of social policy; and migratory inflows. The impacts of the economic crisis and its severe austerity measures have shaken welfare structures and, in particular, the intermediate strata. We need to focus on both the labour market and education to understand how these two aspects are coalescing into a spiral of increased intra- and inter-class polarization.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Crisis%2C+social+class%2C+employment+and+education&amp;rft.au=de+Lucas%2C+Fernando&amp;rft.aulast=de+Lucas&amp;rft.aufirst=Fernando&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Losing control in pre-adoption services: Finnish prospective adoptive parents emotional experiences of vulnerability

Author: Eriksson, Pia K

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816649893?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article argues that the institutional context of pre-adoption services in inter-country adoptions fosters straining emotions in prospective adoptive parents through controlling practices, thus putting clients in a vulnerable situation. The article analyses the power and emotions involved in the relationship between the client and the professional, based on nineteen narrative interviews conducted with former prospective adoptive parents in Finland. The results of the study suggest that prospective adoptive parents perceive power through three types of controlling practices: support for emotional readiness, entitlement to professional interpretations, and time and information control. In combination with the broader social setting of the inter-country adoption process, these practices give rise to a dependency that fosters emotions of anger and fear at differing levels of intensity. The implications of the study call for an acknowledgement of power and emotion as important issues in pre-adoptions services, and prompt changes to be undertaken in professional practice and discourse, through collaborative definitions of aims and needs within the services.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Losing+control+in+pre-adoption+services%3A+Finnish+prospective+adoptive+parents+emotional+experiences+of+vulnerability&amp;rft.au=Eriksson%2C+Pia+K&amp;rft.aulast=Eriksson&amp;rft.aufirst=Pia&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Serious Illness and End-of-Life Care in the Homeless: Examining a Service System and a Call for Action for Social Work

Author: Davis-Berman, Jennifer

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816649909?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article reports on a qualitative study done in a medium sized Midwestern city in the United States that attempted to understand and examine the service network for the provision of healthcare for serious illness and end-of-life care for the homeless. Ten key informants representing critical healthcare services and facilities providing service to low income and homeless populations were interviewed. Two women and two men residing in the homeless shelter were also interviewed. Based on these in-depth interviews, the following themes were identified and presented for analysis: Lack of services for serious, chronic and life threatening illness, Barriers to access to services, Stigma, and End-of-life care. Implications for social work practice were presented and discussed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Serious+Illness+and+End-of-Life+Care+in+the+Homeless%3A+Examining+a+Service+System+and+a+Call+for+Action+for+Social+Work&amp;rft.au=Davis-Berman%2C+Jennifer&amp;rft.aulast=Davis-Berman&amp;rft.aufirst=Jennifer&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Participation and social services local intervention in spain

Author: Seller, Enrique Pastor

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816649912?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article presents an analysis of the range opportunities for citizens' participation, in general, and of the social entities in particular - i.e. associative participation - in the design, implementation, follow-up and assessment of the public policies directing care services at a local level in Spain, as well as their possible influence on the agenda and management of local public policies for social welfare. The results of this research allow us to present a theoretical and regulatory framework of what is happening at a European and national level, as well as giving details about the autonomous regions of Spain. In the case of the autonomous communities, we must highlight the changes that new Social Services laws have brought about in terms of widening citizens' participation and opening up feedback for users of the system at a local level. In addition, this article discusses the role of different typologies and offer of mechanisms, bodies and process of participation in the design, management and assessment of social welfare policies at a local level. Finally, we determine the factors that help to increase the efficiency of social public policies, by means of an increase in citizens' participation in local governance.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Participation+and+social+services+local+intervention+in+spain&amp;rft.au=Seller%2C+Enrique+Pastor&amp;rft.aulast=Seller&amp;rft.aufirst=Enrique&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

One Size Doesn't Fit All: Diversifying research on active labor market policies

Author: Danneris, Sophie

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816649930?accountid=14667

Abstract: Over several decades, there has accumulated a large body of research on active labor market policies (ALMP). In particular, numerous programs designed to encourage welfare recipients to move into work and off benefits have been evaluated in western countries such as Denmark. The results of the research have been selectively influential in shaping policy developments, but as this paper will demonstrate, there are several biases attached to this research. Based on an extensive mapping review of both Danish and international literature, this paper contributes with a systematic overview of the current research within the field. By focusing on the range of these studies (in design, populations covered and substantive issues addressed), the review looks beyond the specific results of each study, and illuminates substantial gaps in the knowledge produced. The analysis shows that the research is lacking sensitivity toward the complexity of the field, in particular regarding the diversity of the clients being served and the variety of challenges they confront.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=One+Size+Doesn%27t+Fit+All%3A+Diversifying+research+on+active+labor+market+policies&amp;rft.au=Danneris%2C+Sophie&amp;rft.aulast=Danneris&amp;rft.aufirst=Sophie&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=One+Size+Doesn%27t+Fit+All%3A+Diversifying+research+on+active+labor+market+policies&amp;rft.au=Danneris%2C+Sophie&amp;rft.aulast=Danneris&amp;rft.aufirst=Sophie&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Labor, health, social work and the middle classes: Do Spanish youth have to jeopardize their health to find a job?

Author: López-Peláez, Antonio

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816650067?accountid=14667

Abstract: In the sphere of the European Union, especially in countries of southern Europe, the economic crisis and the redefining of welfare state benefits have led to a scenario in which many young people encounter major difficulties in attaining and/or maintaining a middle-class lifestyle. Their life trajectories may be affected not only by wage or job insecurity, but also by occupational hazards due to poor working conditions. In this paper, we examine the changes in occupational safety and health in Spain. The results shed light on the precarious working conditions of Spanish youth; a key factor in the failed career paths of young people. For this reason, one of the priorities of social work intervention programs should be the prevention of occupational hazards and workplace health promotion.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Labor%2C+health%2C+social+work+and+the+middle+classes%3A+Do+Spanish+youth+have+to+jeopardize+their+health+to+find+a+job%3F&amp;rft.au=L%C3%B3pez-Pel%C3%A1ez%2C+Antonio&amp;rft.aulast=L%C3%B3pez-Pel%C3%A1ez&amp;rft.aufirst=Antonio&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Community mediation: a tool for citizen participation in public policy

Author: Carrasco, Marta Blanco

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816650124?accountid=14667

Abstract: Significant new legislation has been enacted regulating access to the professional practice of mediation, the mediation process and its potential outcomes. However, we should not make the mistake of believing that mediation is the answer to any dispute. This study is based on the firm belief that, while mediation is appropriate in certain cases, it is not a panacea. We need to defend the discipline by defining the limits of mediation, even if by doing so we may reduce its potential scope and outcomes. Attempting to adapt mediation to every dispute can only result in diluting its impact to the point that it loses credibility. The paper critically examines the evolution of mediation as an alternative dispute resolution (ADR) mechanism and its future challenges. It first examines the differences between mediation and various other forms of ADR in order to define the boundaries of the former. The paper then analyzes the different subfields within civil and commercial mediation in order to clearly define the position of community mediation within the wider field thus, hopefully, according it true identity and credibility as an independent profession. Finally, the paper examines the role of mediation as a tool to encourage citizens to participate in and take responsibility for community life, especially in the context of conflicts in the community. In this sense, community mediation extends well beyond the traditional scope of mediation, which merely seeks to resolve conflicts

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Community+mediation%3A+a+tool+for+citizen+participation+in+public+policy&amp;rft.au=Carrasco%2C+Marta+Blanco&amp;rft.aulast=Carrasco&amp;rft.aufirst=Marta&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Community+mediation%3A+a+tool+for+citizen+participation+in+public+policy&amp;rft.au=Carrasco%2C+Marta+Blanco&amp;rft.aulast=Carrasco&amp;rft.aufirst=Marta&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Eugenics and special education in the Czech lands during the Interwar Period: The beginning of segregation against disabled and Roma

Author: Schmidt, Victoria

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816650125?accountid=14667

Abstract: This text puts forwards the argument that the development of education for deviant and disabled children and the formation of practices aimed at controlling the Roma population during socialism echo those developed during the interwar period. The introduction engages with the current trend to revise social welfare policies and practices in the light of the history of eugenics. Then, the text turns to the case of Czech lands where the institutionalization of Roma surveillance was outstandingly pervasive in comparison to the rest of Central and Eastern Europe. The first part explores the development of eugenics in the Czech lands and establishes a temporal framework needed for the understanding of the relationship between eugenics and child protection. The second part discusses how eugenic ideas were applied within correctional institutions for minors with delinquent behavior and mental disability. In the third part I examine the reform towards forced legitimization of the nomad Roma , payingspecial attention to the institutionalization of Roma children. In the final part, I discuss the historical implications for s the path dependencyand segregation of the Roma population in the Czech lands.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Eugenics+and+special+education+in+the+Czech+lands+during+the+Interwar+Period%3A+The+beginning+of+segregation+against+disabled+and+Roma&amp;rft.au=Schmidt%2C+Victoria&amp;rft.aulast=Schmidt&amp;rft.aufirst=Victoria&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Children orphaned by AIDS in Uganda: Can they thrive under orphanage care?

Author: Rukundo, Priscillah; Daniel, Marguerite

Publication info: Social Work and Society ; Bielefeld  Vol. 14, Iss. 1,  (2016): 1.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1816650127?accountid=14667

Abstract: Care for orphaned children is one of the major challenges facing AIDS-affected communities. Usually orphaned children are cared for by extended families; alternative living arrangements may include orphanages and child-headed households. This study focuses on orphanage care to (1) identify coping strategies used by orphaned children to deal with various challenges and (2) explore ways in which orphanages contribute to orphaned children's wellbeing. Twelve children living in an externally-funded, family-style orphanage were interviewed. Staff members from the same orphanage and from two other organizations caring for orphaned children (six in total) were interviewed. Challenges faced by the children included mourning the loss of parents, longing to meet relatives and stigmatization of HIV positive children. The children coped by drawing on their faith, making friends and by avoiding and ignoring. The children's basic needs were well provided for by the orphanage but there was a gap in psychosocial support. Connections with relatives were lacking for several children.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Children+orphaned+by+AIDS+in+Uganda%3A+Can+they+thrive+under+orphanage+care%3F&amp;rft.au=Rukundo%2C+Priscillah%3BDaniel%2C+Marguerite&amp;rft.aulast=Rukundo&amp;rft.aufirst=Priscillah&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=1&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Social+Work+and+Society&amp;rft.issn=16138953&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Disability and the Quest for Bureaucratic Representation in Zimbabwe

Author: Mtetwa, Edmos; Ruparanganda, Watch

Publication info: Indian Journal of Social Work ; Bombay  Vol. 77, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 39.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1819946807?accountid=14667

Abstract: Bureaucratic representation has become more topical, especially in the 21st century with the emphasis placed on a rights based approach to governance. Various previously marginalised groups including women and minority ethnic groups now firmly believe that unless and until they become visible within various decision making structures, it is likely that such decisions might not reflect their aspirations. The slogan "nothing about us without us" is fast gaining visibility among persons with disabilities. This paper therefore seeks to highlight the quest for bureaucratic representation by persons with disabilities in Zimbabwe. Using a narrative enquiry, the study is informed by submissions from five persons with visual impairments, five persons with albinism and two disability workshops attended by the authors. Results revealed that the government does not have any policy on the promotion of persons with disabilities within the national bureaucracy thereby leaving everything to personal discretion. The paper concludes by giving recommendations as to how the government must proceed in meeting the pleas for bureaucratic representation by persons with disabilities.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Disability+and+the+Quest+for+Bureaucratic+Representation+in+Zimbabwe&amp;rft.au=Mtetwa%2C+Edmos%3BRuparanganda%2C+Watch&amp;rft.aulast=Mtetwa&amp;rft.aufirst=Edmos&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=77&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=39&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00195634&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

The Unruly Young Men: Exploring some Key Constructions of Masculinity within Swedish Social Services

Author: Johansson, Helena; Johansson, Ing-Marie

Publication info: Indian Journal of Social Work ; Bombay  Vol. 77, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 21.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1819946854?accountid=14667

Abstract: The article draws on two research projects conducted at the University of Gothenburg and highlights how social workers construct and reconstruct young masculinities. In the light of recent debates in India, induced by the gang rapes in New Delhi, the intersection between masculinity and class is of great relevance to social work. Research from both countries highlights a problematic situation within social work as boys from lower social classes often are predicted to become low achievers or drug addicts. Instead our focal point should be turned towards how we in interaction with our surroundings are shaped as males and females.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=The+Unruly+Young+Men%3A+Exploring+some+Key+Constructions+of+Masculinity+within+Swedish+Social+Services&amp;rft.au=Johansson%2C+Helena%3BJohansson%2C+Ing-Marie&amp;rft.aulast=Johansson&amp;rft.aufirst=Helena&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=77&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=21&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00195634&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Understanding the Growth Needs and Challenges of Non-governmental Organ isations

Author: Awasthy, Richa; Sharma, Nihar

Publication info: Indian Journal of Social Work ; Bombay  Vol. 77, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 67.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1819946879?accountid=14667

Abstract: The purpose of the study is to unearth the enablers in managing non-governmental organisations (NGOs) professionally. The study intends to understand the NGO from three perspectives: evolution and revolution as organisational growth by Greiner (1998); Weisbord&apos;s Six-Box Model; and organisational culture from Competing Value Framework (Cameron and Quinn, 1999). The exploratory study followed the mixed methods approach for data collection. The findings reiterate that the growth stages of NGOs are similar to that of business organisations. The study validates that efficient leadership is vital in accelerating the growth and managing crisis situations in NGOs. The findings reveal that by adopting ambidextrous structures, organisations can successfully transition to the next evolutionary phase.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Understanding+the+Growth+Needs+and+Challenges+of+Non-governmental+Organ+isations&amp;rft.au=Awasthy%2C+Richa%3BSharma%2C+Nihar&amp;rft.aulast=Awasthy&amp;rft.aufirst=Richa&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=77&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=67&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00195634&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Livelihood Security for Rural Households through MGNREGA in Tamil Nadu

Author: Pandi, Jagadees

Publication info: Indian Journal of Social Work ; Bombay  Vol. 77, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 91.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1819946916?accountid=14667

Abstract: The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) has completed eight years since its inception in India. The aim of this programme is to enhance livelihood security of households in rural areas of the country by providing at least one hundred days of manual wage employment to every household in a year. Tamil Nadu is one among the high performing states implementing the scheme. The present article aims to examining the impact of the Act on the socioeconomic status of rural workers in selected districts of Tamil Nadu. Multi-stage sampling method was adopted. A total of 450 workers (both male and female) were chosen for this study. The Act has brought about a significant change in the livelihood of rural poor as it has ensured food security to the rural poor.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Livelihood+Security+for+Rural+Households+through+MGNREGA+in+Tamil+Nadu&amp;rft.au=Pandi%2C+Jagadees&amp;rft.aulast=Pandi&amp;rft.aufirst=Jagadees&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=77&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=91&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00195634&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Livelihood+Security+for+Rural+Households+through+MGNREGA+in+Tamil+Nadu&amp;rft.au=Pandi%2C+Jagadees&amp;rft.aulast=Pandi&amp;rft.aufirst=Jagadees&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=77&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=91&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00195634&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Title: Livelihood Security for Rural Households through MGNREGA in Tamil Nadu

Publication title: Indian Journal of Social Work; Bombay

Volume: 77

Issue: 1

First page: 91

Publication year: 2016

Social Reform by Quaker Women: A CASE STUDY OF LUCRETIA MOTT

Author: Sharma, Satish

Publication info: Indian Journal of Social Work ; Bombay  Vol. 77, Iss. 1,  (Jan 2016): 7.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1819946970?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article focuses on Lucretia Mott, a prominent minister, abolitionist, pacifist, religionist, fighter for women's rights, and social reformer Times, conditions, and circumstances have changed, but personal, social, and societal struggles have not and there is as much need for social reform today as during Lucretia's times. How to discern, handle, and deal with modern-day problems and issues, Lucretia's endeavours shed light on that and social reformers of the present times can learn much from her example and experiences. Students and scholars in sociology, women's studies, religious studies, historical accounts, social change, and social welfare will find the contents of this article quite useful.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Social+Reform+by+Quaker+Women%3A+A+CASE+STUDY+OF+LUCRETIA+MOTT&amp;rft.au=Sharma%2C+Satish&amp;rft.aulast=Sharma&amp;rft.aufirst=Satish&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=77&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=7&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00195634&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Social+Reform+by+Quaker+Women%3A+A+CASE+STUDY+OF+LUCRETIA+MOTT&amp;rft.au=Sharma%2C+Satish&amp;rft.aulast=Sharma&amp;rft.aufirst=Satish&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=77&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=7&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Indian+Journal+of+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=00195634&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Military Veterans in the Criminal Justice System: Partner Violence and the Impact of Relationships With Fathers

Author: Schaffer, Bradley J

Publication info: Journal of Evidence-Based Social Work ; Abingdon  Vol. 13, Iss. 4,  (2016): 394.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1821115024?accountid=14667

Abstract: The objective of this study is to examine the health characteristics of military veterans identified through the Criminal Justice System (CJS) with partner violence and their relationships with their fathers. The 282 veterans involved in the CJS participated to complete a psycho-social assessment which included partner violence and ascertained their relationships with their fathers. The mean age of the men in the study was 44.9 years old. The majority were divorced, Caucasian, had a high school education, and served in the Army. This sample shows the benefit of integrating partner violence and relationships with fathers into the assessment process and highlights the need for more research.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Military+Veterans+in+the+Criminal+Justice+System%3A+Partner+Violence+and+the+Impact+of+Relationships+With+Fathers&amp;rft.au=Schaffer%2C+Bradley+J&amp;rft.aulast=Schaffer&amp;rft.aufirst=Bradley&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=394&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

A Comprehensive Literature Review of Randomized Controlled Trials for Parents of Young Children with Autism Spectrum Disorder

Author: Dababnah, Sarah; Parish, Susan L

Publication info: Journal of Evidence-Based Social Work ; Abingdon  Vol. 13, Iss. 3,  (2016): 277.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1821115042?accountid=14667

Abstract: Parents raising young children with autism spectrum disorder are particularly vulnerable to stress and poor coping mechanisms. The current article describes a comprehensive review of randomized controlled trials which included parents of preschool-age children with autism spectrum disorder. Seven interventions met the review criteria. The studies were strengthened by the use of fidelity measures and developmentally appropriate interventions. However, while all of the studies collected parent measures, none reported significant post-test improvements in parent mental health or other outcomes. Furthermore, numerous issues, such as unclear randomization strategies, small sample sizes, and poor external validity, further limited the ability to draw significant conclusions regarding the promise of the interventions. More research is needed to develop and rigorously test family-centered interventions aimed at improving both child and parent outcomes.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=A+Comprehensive+Literature+Review+of+Randomized+Controlled+Trials+for+Parents+of+Young+Children+with+Autism+Spectrum+Disorder&amp;rft.au=Dababnah%2C+Sarah%3BParish%2C+Susan+L&amp;rft.aulast=Dababnah&amp;rft.aufirst=Sarah&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=277&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Building Agency Capacity for Trauma-Informed Evidence-Based Practice and Field Instruction

Author: Strand, Virginia; Popescu, Marciana; Abramovitz, Robert; Richards, Sean

Publication info: Journal of Evidence-Based Social Work ; Abingdon  Vol. 13, Iss. 2,  (2016): 179.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1821115049?accountid=14667

Abstract: Through this article the authors describe how schools of social work offering a child and adolescent trauma specialization actively partnered with their community-based field placement agencies to achieve a dual purpose: help agencies sustain the capacity for evidence-based trauma treatment (EBTT) and provide sufficient EBTT MSW student field placement sites that support preparation of trauma-informed practitioners by schools of social work. Development and description of the specific conceptual framework used to inform the trauma-informed organizational change initiative is described. Results of an Organizational Readiness assessment undertaken at six agencies reflect a strong alignment between implementation drivers identified in the literature (Fixsen, Blase, Naoom, & Wallace, 2009) and the conceptual framework. The manner in which these results are being used by schools of social work and their agency partners in sustaining the implementation of evidence-based trauma treatment is reviewed, and implications for future research, education, and practice is discussed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Building+Agency+Capacity+for+Trauma-Informed+Evidence-Based+Practice+and+Field+Instruction&amp;rft.au=Strand%2C+Virginia%3BPopescu%2C+Marciana%3BAbramovitz%2C+Robert%3BRichards%2C+Sean&amp;rft.aulast=Strand&amp;rft.aufirst=Virginia&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=179&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Decrease in Behavioral Problems and Trauma Symptoms Among At-Risk Adopted Children Following Web-Based Trauma-Informed Parent Training Intervention

Author: Razuri, Erin Becker; Howard, Amanda R Hiles; Parris, Sheri R; Call, Casey D; DeLuna, Jamie Hurst; Hall, Jordan S; Purvis, Karyn B; Cross, David R

Publication info: Journal of Evidence-Based Social Work ; Abingdon  Vol. 13, Iss. 2,  (2016): 165.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1821115062?accountid=14667

Abstract: Children who have experienced early adversities are at risk for behavioral problems and trauma symptoms. Using a two-group, pre-post intervention design, the authors evaluated the effectiveness of an online parent training for Trust-Based Relational Intervention, a trauma-informed, attachment-based intervention, in reducing behavioral problems and trauma symptoms in at-risk adopted children. Children of parents in the treatment group (n = 48) demonstrated significant decreases in behavioral problems and trauma symptoms after intervention. Scores for children in a matched-sample control group did not change. Findings suggest this intervention can effectively reduce behavioral problems and trauma symptoms in children with histories of adversities.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Decrease+in+Behavioral+Problems+and+Trauma+Symptoms+Among+At-Risk+Adopted+Children+Following+Web-Based+Trauma-Informed+Parent+Training+Intervention&amp;rft.au=Razuri%2C+Erin+Becker%3BHoward%2C+Amanda+R+Hiles%3BParris%2C+Sheri+R%3BCall%2C+Casey+D%3BDeLuna%2C+Jamie+Hurst%3BHall%2C+Jordan+S%3BPurvis%2C+Karyn+B%3BCross%2C+David+R&amp;rft.aulast=Razuri&amp;rft.aufirst=Erin&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=165&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Decrease+in+Behavioral+Problems+and+Trauma+Symptoms+Among+At-Risk+Adopted+Children+Following+Web-Based+Trauma-Informed+Parent+Training+Intervention&amp;rft.au=Razuri%2C+Erin+Becker%3BHoward%2C+Amanda+R+Hiles%3BParris%2C+Sheri+R%3BCall%2C+Casey+D%3BDeLuna%2C+Jamie+Hurst%3BHall%2C+Jordan+S%3BPurvis%2C+Karyn+B%3BCross%2C+David+R&amp;rft.aulast=Razuri&amp;rft.aufirst=Erin&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=165&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Does Internalizing Society and Media Messages Cause Body Dissatisfaction, in Turn Causing Disordered Eating?

Author: Dye, Heather

Publication info: Journal of Evidence-Based Social Work ; Abingdon  Vol. 13, Iss. 2,  (2016): 217.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1821115130?accountid=14667

Abstract: The purpose of this study was to examine the predictive influence that internalization of society and media messages has on body dissatisfaction, as well as the prediction influence that body dissatisfaction has on disordered eating behaviors, such as preoccupation with weight, dieting, and eating restraint. A total of 324 participants completed the demographic questionnaire, the Multidimensional Body Self Relations Questionnaire (Cash, 2001 Cash, T. F. (2001). Multidimensional body-self relations questionnaire: MBSRQ user's manual. Norfolk, VA: Old Dominion University.), the Sociocultural Attitudes Towards Appearance Questionnaire (Heinberg, Thompson, & Stormer, 1995 Heinberg, L. J., Thompson, J. K., & Stormer, S. (1995). Development and validation of the sociocultural attitudes towards appearance questionnaire. International Journal of Eating Disorders, 17, 81-89.) for women, and the Sociocultural Attitudes Towards Appearance Questionnaire-Revised-Male-Version (Cusumano & Thompson, 1997 Cusumano, D. L., & Thompson, J. K. (1997). Body image and body shape ideals in magazines: Exposure, awareness, and internalization. Sex Roles, 37, 701-721.) for men, and the locus of control (Rotter, 1966 Rotter, J. B. (1966). Generalized expectancies for internal versus external control of reinforcement. Psychological Monographs, 80(1), 1-28.). The results of this study found that high internalization leads to body dissatisfaction, in turn, leading to disordered eating behaviors, such as preoccupation with weight, dieting, and eating restraint. This study proposes the implementation of media literacy and education programs that teach college women and men, girls and boys, to think more critically about the media.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Does+Internalizing+Society+and+Media+Messages+Cause+Body+Dissatisfaction%2C+in+Turn+Causing+Disordered+Eating%3F&amp;rft.au=Dye%2C+Heather&amp;rft.aulast=Dye&amp;rft.aufirst=Heather&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=217&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Does+Internalizing+Society+and+Media+Messages+Cause+Body+Dissatisfaction%2C+in+Turn+Causing+Disordered+Eating%3F&amp;rft.au=Dye%2C+Heather&amp;rft.aulast=Dye&amp;rft.aufirst=Heather&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=217&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

A Ground-Up Model for Gun Violence Reduction: A Community-Based Public Health Approach

Author: Byrdsong, T Rashad; Devan, Angela; Yamatani, Hide

Publication info: Journal of Evidence-Based Social Work ; Abingdon  Vol. 13, Iss. 1,  (2016): 76.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1821115151?accountid=14667

Abstract: The suggested strategy for the reduction of violence is to collaboratively address the problem, based on an intervention system focused on prevention, rehabilitation, and development. This strategy is capable of engaging community residents in positive ways, and it empowers them to take ownership and sustain much-needed resident commitments to achieve long-term public safety. The community residents largely insist that over-reliance on law enforcement to control violence invites further affliction among Black youth and adults.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=A+Ground-Up+Model+for+Gun+Violence+Reduction%3A+A+Community-Based+Public+Health+Approach&amp;rft.au=Byrdsong%2C+T+Rashad%3BDevan%2C+Angela%3BYamatani%2C+Hide&amp;rft.aulast=Byrdsong&amp;rft.aufirst=T&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=76&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

The Cry of the Child and its Relationship to Hearing Loss in Parental Guardians and Health Care Providers

Author: Calderon, Lindsay E; Carney, Logan D; Kavanagh, Kevin T

Publication info: Journal of Evidence-Based Social Work ; Abingdon  Vol. 13, Iss. 2,  (2016): 198.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1821115199?accountid=14667

Abstract: In this study the authors investigate the sound pressure levels produced by crying children and discuss the possible adverse effects that direct exposure may impose on a tending guardian or healthcare professional. Sound intensity levels from various pediatric patients (N = 26) were measured under two segregate conditions, one imitating the exposure of an examining physician and the other resembling that of parental guardians. Interestingly, all of the recorded sound levels fell between 99-120 dB(A) of sound pressure; children presenting the greatest risk for intense cries with potentially harmful sound intensities were between the ages of 9 months and 6 years. The authors found that elevated noise levels produced from crying children can cause acute discomfort and mild pain to those exposed. In addition, there is a theoretical risk that chronic exposure to these intense sound pressures may result in noise-induced hearing loss in a parental guardian or an examining physician. Parents of young children may be more likely to succumb to impulsive reactions in attempting to arrest the crying, which could be a precipitating factor for child abuse, responding to physical stress as much as emotional stress. Social workers and medical personnel should consider suggesting the use of ear plugs by parental guardians of frequently crying children as a modality for the prevention of child abuse.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=The+Cry+of+the+Child+and+its+Relationship+to+Hearing+Loss+in+Parental+Guardians+and+Health+Care+Providers&amp;rft.au=Calderon%2C+Lindsay+E%3BCarney%2C+Logan+D%3BKavanagh%2C+Kevin+T&amp;rft.aulast=Calderon&amp;rft.aufirst=Lindsay&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=198&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=The+Cry+of+the+Child+and+its+Relationship+to+Hearing+Loss+in+Parental+Guardians+and+Health+Care+Providers&amp;rft.au=Calderon%2C+Lindsay+E%3BCarney%2C+Logan+D%3BKavanagh%2C+Kevin+T&amp;rft.aulast=Calderon&amp;rft.aufirst=Lindsay&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=198&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Socio-Demographic Factors, Social Support, Quality of Life, and HIV/AIDS in Ghana

Author: Abrefa-Gyan, Tina; Cornelius, Llewellyn J; Okundaye, Joshua

Publication info: Journal of Evidence-Based Social Work ; Abingdon  Vol. 13, Iss. 2,  (2016): 206.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1821115256?accountid=14667

Abstract: The increase in the access to biomedical interventions for people living with HIV/AIDS in the developing world has not been adequately matched with the requisite psychosocial treatments to help improve the effectiveness of biomedical interventions. Therefore, in this study the author seeks to determine whether socio-demographic characteristics and social support are associated with quality of life in individuals diagnosed with HIV/AIDS in Ghana. A convenience sample of 300 HIV/AIDS support group members was obtained via cross-sectional design survey. The Medical Outcome Studies (MOS) HIV Health Survey, the MOS Social Support Survey (MOS-SSS), and demographic questionnaire instruments were used to assess quality of life, social support, and demographic information respectively. Multiple regression analysis showed that there was a positive association between overall social support and overall quality of life (r = .51). It also showed that being younger, male, attending support group meetings for over a year, and having = 13 years of schooling related to higher quality of life. Implications of the findings for practice, policy, and research in Ghana and the rest of the developing world are discussed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Socio-Demographic+Factors%2C+Social+Support%2C+Quality+of+Life%2C+and+HIV%2FAIDS+in+Ghana&amp;rft.au=Abrefa-Gyan%2C+Tina%3BCornelius%2C+Llewellyn+J%3BOkundaye%2C+Joshua&amp;rft.aulast=Abrefa-Gyan&amp;rft.aufirst=Tina&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=206&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Socio-Demographic+Factors%2C+Social+Support%2C+Quality+of+Life%2C+and+HIV%2FAIDS+in+Ghana&amp;rft.au=Abrefa-Gyan%2C+Tina%3BCornelius%2C+Llewellyn+J%3BOkundaye%2C+Joshua&amp;rft.aulast=Abrefa-Gyan&amp;rft.aufirst=Tina&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=206&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Provider Agency Practices as a Source of Social Work EBP

Author: Blakely, Thomas J; Dziadosz, Gregory M

Publication info: Journal of Evidence-Based Social Work ; Abingdon  Vol. 13, Iss. 4,  (2016): 354.

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=https://search.proquest.com/docview/1821115311?accountid=14667

Abstract: Through this article the authors propose that agency service provider systems may be a source of evidence-based practices (EBP). One agency's design and implementation of a program entitled Community Treatment and Rehabilitation is presented as an example. The elements of this program conform to the creation of EBPs. It was formulated with consideration of clients' values and judgments through their participation at every step in the assessment and treatment process. Staff clinicians were trained in established EBP interventions, such as cognitive therapy, embedded in a system of ordered assessment, treatment, and outcome evaluation. A controlled research design was used to gather outcome data to inform clinicians' decisions about interventions that were then systematically applied with clients. The delivery system was organized for clinical supervisors to guide staff clinical practices so that all were operating on the same set of guidelines allowing for similar outcomes to occur with similar interventions. This method of developing EBPs makes them available for application immediately and successfully eliminates the delay between development and implementation that usually occurs with other sources of EBPs.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Provider+Agency+Practices+as+a+Source+of+Social+Work+EBP&amp;rft.au=Blakely%2C+Thomas+J%3BDziadosz%2C+Gregory+M&amp;rft.aulast=Blakely&amp;rft.aufirst=Thomas&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=354&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservices&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.atitle=Provider+Agency+Practices+as+a+Source+of+Social+Work+EBP&amp;rft.au=Blakely%2C+Thomas+J%3BDziadosz%2C+Gregory+M&amp;rft.aulast=Blakely&amp;rft.aufirst=Thomas&amp;rft.date=2016-01-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=354&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Journal+of+Evidence-Based+Social+Work&amp;rft.issn=15433714&amp;rft_id=info:doi/
